title.children: WikiLeaks leaked a video showing two of Dean's colleagues being killed. The truth left him reeling

image.altText: Greens party members Max Chandler-Mather and Adam Bandt at a press conference.

items.synopsis: The federal government's key housing policy is set to pass parliament after a deal was reached with the Greens.

title.children: Government's key housing policy set to pass parliament after deal with Greens

image.altText: Crime figure Gavin Preston looks unsmilingly into the camera as he poses for a photo.

items.synopsis: Police continueÂ to search for two men after a fatal shooting at a Keilor cafe, as CBD traders raise fears about Melbourne's reputation.

title.children: Search continues for two offenders after fatal cafe shooting of underworld figure Gavin Preston

image.altText: newspaper clippings surrounding old photographs of a man

items.synopsis: Premier Daniel Andrews's new inquiry has been tasked with untangling a web of horrors relating to just 18 Victorian government schools. The single case of serial paedophile headmaster William LandmanÂ shows why a broader examination is needed, writes investigative reporter Russell Jackson.

title.children: Prolific paedophile William Landman was a criminal before he was a teacher. He and other abusers will not be examined in a new inquiry

image.altText: Oxfam office

items.synopsis: With unions embedding trials of the four-day work week in industrial agreements, is this the moment the working-hour-reducing concept goes mainstream?

items.synopsis: We've known for some time theÂ body mass indexÂ is an inaccurate measuring stickÂ for assessing someone's weight and health. So why is such an imperfect tool still being used, and what should we use instead, asks Rachael Jefferson-Buchanan.

title.children: Doctors' over-reliance on BMI may be harming patients' health. Here's what we should test instead

image.altText: A middle-aged man of Indian heritage in a black suit speaks against a dark backdrop.

title.children: British PM chides China after report parliamentary staffer spying for Beijing

image.altText: Composite Kerry Frankcombe and marine rescue personnel.

items.synopsis: Conditions were good when Kerry Frankcombe set out for a Sunday afternoon fishing trip off Tasmania's north coast, police say. But the 75-year-old has not been since, despite his boat being found with an EPIRB not activated.

title.children: Empty boat found at sea after Tasmanian man embarks on fishing trip

image.altText: A close up of marigold flowers in an urban environment.

items.synopsis: Green roofs are proven to boost biodiversity, energy efficiency and people's wellbeing. But, unlike other countries, Australia's big cities have just a few dozen.Â

title.children: Green roofs bring many benefits, but gardening up high poses some unique challenges

title.children: 'We're going to sink': Residents escape island hit by rising sea levels

image.altText: A man wearing a suit jacket and sunglasses walks outside the court building.

items.synopsis: A jury has been dismissed after hearing months of evidence in the trial of Cecil Kennedy, who prosecutors alleged had givenÂ Jordan Thompson a dose of Endep because he wanted to keep him quiet.

title.children: Jurors fail to reach verdict for man accused of giving toddler lethal dose of antidepressants

items.synopsis: A 20 year-old man, a 17-year-old boy and a 21-year-old woman were arrested by police over the incident.

title.children: Three people charged following car theft and stabbing in Melbourne's north

image.altText: A police vehicle and officer in front of police tape at the side of a lake

items.synopsis: A body has been recovered fromÂ Stockton Lake, near Collie, but it is yet to be formally identified, as the search for a missing 23-year-old man continues.

title.children: Body found at popular WA swimming spot amid search for missing man

image.altText: Novak Djokovic holds up his hands

items.synopsis: Novak Djokovic isÂ 36 years old, has won more grand slam singles titles than any other man in history with 24 to his name â€” but incredibly, he's still learning and hungry for more.

title.children: The ominous sentence that shows newly crowned US Open champion Novak Djokovic is not done yet

image.altText: A man with a moustache and nose ring wearing a hat leans against a tree trunk.Â

items.synopsis: As Australians prepare to vote in a historic referendum, the ABC's Voice correspondent Dan Bourchier travels to the north, west and east of the country for Four Corners and finds a nation grappling with its future.

title.children: Ben was going to vote Yes to the Voice. Now he's a hard No

image.altText: A plume of smoke from a bushfire, with a dry paddock in the foreground.

items.synopsis: Fire and emergency services are working to contain a fire burning through national parkland south of BundabergÂ that prompted an emergency evacuation alert earlier today.Â

title.children: Fire crews continue to battle blaze in national park after emergency bushfire evacuation south of Bundaberg

image.altText: life saving volunteer entering the water with floating device

items.synopsis: The national report by the Royal Life Saving Society AustraliaÂ found 42 per cent of drownings occurred more than 5 kilometres from a Surf Life Saving service.

title.children: Number of child drownings decrease while more men fall victim, national report reveals

image.altText: Peter Payne stands in front of a gate

items.synopsis: A magistrate calls bush solicitorÂ Peter Payne'sÂ crime "unsophisticated" but saysÂ it crossed the line.

title.children: 'They're setting a trap for you': NSW publican-turned-lawyer convicted after helping client avoid court

image.altText: an aerial view of an outback bushfire

items.synopsis: Authorities have been goingÂ door-to-door in parts of the town ofÂ Tennant CreekÂ warning residents that a major bushfireÂ could spread to the townÂ amid extreme fire conditions.

title.children: Tennant Creek residents warned to prepare as major bushfire burns closer to outback town

image.altText: An Indigenous boy, slightly smiling, looks at camera, neck-long curly hair, slight moustache and beard.

items.synopsis: Markyia Major, 17, from Yarrabah, near Cairns, has not had any contact with family for a month or accessed his bank account.

title.children: Police launch a major investigation into teen's disappearance as fears for his safety grow

image.altText: A dark-haired man in his 30s and his mother, about 60, sit in front of a tent with their two dogs.

items.synopsis: Matt Turner has a job and perfectÂ tenancy references, but the housing crisis has left him at his lowest point.

title.children: 'It's hard living in a tent and going to work every day': Why this employed 34yo and his mum are homeless

image.altText: A young boy looking at the camera while kneeling near a pile of rubble.

items.synopsis: Everyone left in Moulay Ibrahim has a story of their narrow escape â€” just ask 11-year-oldÂ Abdarazak Abou Aalam, whose tragic tour of the town starts at his neighbour's house, which was destroyed in Friday's earthquake.

title.children: In this devastated Moroccan village, an 11yo earthquake survivor gives a tour of the rubble

image.altText: Ashton Kutcher and Mila Kunis appear in a video apologising.

items.synopsis: Four of Danny Masterson's That '70s Show cast mates wrote character letters in support of the convicted rapist, including Ashton Kutcher and Mila Kunis.

title.children: Ashton Kutcher, Mila Kunis face growing backlash over Danny Masterson support

image.altText: An illustration of a car, house, health kit and book in an opened gift box

items.synopsis: Some experts say a salary sacrifice orÂ a salary package agreement can help maximise income and reduce tax debtÂ â€” depending on the industry you're in and what your employer offers.

title.children: Ever heard of salary sacrifice? Here's what it is and how it can help reduce debt

image.altText: An Indigenous man and a teenager stand next to each other in playground.

items.synopsis: Some of Yardgee's players have gone fromÂ "getting into a lot of trouble" to celebrating premiership glory. But a post-game spectator brawl has cast a cloud overÂ their success.

title.children: Footballers sick of violence ruining the game call on elders, parents to step up

image.altText: planes on an airport runway

items.synopsis: Qantas' board remains under pressure ahead of its annual report, including over whether former CEO Alan Joyce shouldÂ receive his full bonus, and what the board knew about the ACCC's ghost flights investigation.Â Meanwhile, the ASX is slightly higher. Follow live.

title.children: Qantas board under pressure over Joyce bonus and ghost flights, tech stocks await iPhone 15 release, ASX up

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Last week ABS data showed there's a record number of people working two or more jobs right now to make ends meet. If that sounds like you or someone you know, we want to hear from you, too. Get in touch with my colleague David Chau by emailing him at Chau.David@abc.net.au, or slide into his DMs on Twitter:
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: ðŸ“£ If you're working two or more jobs, we want to hear from you

children.content: Â
Last week ABS data showed there's a record number of people working two or more jobs right now to make ends meet.
If that sounds like you or someone you know,
we want to hear from you
, too.
Get in touch with my colleague
David Chau
by emailing him at
Chau.David@abc.net.au
, or slide into his DMs on Twitter:

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Tabcorp has resolved an income tax treatment dispute with the ATO over "various licenses and authorities" that will see the company receive a $45 million after-tax benefit at the end of the 2024 financial year. Under the settlement, Tabcorp will be refunded around $83 million, which accounts for 20% of the disputed tax liabilities and interest, while the proceedings brought by the ATO will also be dismissed. Tabcorp will pay around $37 million to The Lottery Corporation (TLC) as part of a separation deed between the two companies, dated March 25 last year. All up, Tabcorp says it will see a post-tax benefit of approximately $45 million in its financial statements at the end of the 2024 financial year, and will be treated as a significant item.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Tabcorp resolves dispute with ATO, to receive post-tax benefit of $45 million

at the end of the 2024 financial year.

, while the proceedings brought by the ATO will also be dismissed.
Tabcorp will

between the two companies, dated March 25 last year.
All up, Tabcorp says it will see a

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: For those of you who are keen observers of the Aussie dollar, you'll have seen that it's picked up some ground during trade today â€” it's up around 0.9 to 1%, hovering at around 64.36 US cents. It's been a week since the Aussie dollar was above that 64 US cent mark, and although it's edging slightly higher, it hasn't cracked the 65 US cent mark since mid-August. So what's behind today's increase? A stronger Japanese yen, in response to comments by the Bank of Japan's governor Kazuo Ueda, who flagged Japan could soon have enough data to end negative interest rates. That bounce has also been helped by China's consumer prices returning to positive territory, rising by 0.1% in August from a year earlier, which is a sign the economy might be stabilising with an easing of deflationary pressures. But investors are still nervous about the US inflation data coming out later this week (Wednesday, to be precise), and whether the Federal Reserve is finished with rate hikes or more may be on the horizon â€” which will then ripple through the global economy.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: The Aussie dollar is moving higher today, and it's partly thanks to Japan's central bank

items.synopsis: The 19-year-old is the first teen to win the grand slam since Serena Williams in the 90s.Â

items.synopsis: Spanish Football Federation chief Luis Rubiales, engulfed in a scandal over giving an unsolicited kiss to a player onÂ the women's World Cup team last month, says he will resign from his position.

title.children: Spain's soccer chief Luis Rubiales announces resignation over unsolicited kiss

image.altText: Origins of tuberculosis

items.synopsis: Authorities in one of Australia's most remote communities sayÂ the state government "hasn't stepped in to do anything" to support screening efforts locally, after aÂ woman who spent time there died from tuberculosis.

title.children: Remote WA community still waiting for urgentÂ tuberculosis testing nine monthsÂ after 19yo's death

image.altText: AFL players playing a game

items.synopsis: Two men have been charged with assaulting police officers after spectators stormed the field at a country footy final in Queensland.

title.children: Police officers allegedly assaulted after 'disgusting' incident at outback Australian Rules grand final

image.altText: Ukraine drone attack

items.synopsis: Russia launchesÂ nearly three dozen drones at Kyiv overnight, with blasts ringing out across the Ukrainian capital and the surrounding region for around two hours, Ukrainian officials say.

title.children: Russia launches overnight drone attack on Ukrainian capital

image.altText: A brown snake with its tongue out on a rock

items.synopsis: Experts say how you respond in the minutes after a snake bite could be the difference between life and death. It comes after the tragic death of a man bitten by a suspected brown snakeÂ while trying to save a friend in North Queensland.

title.children: Snake season has turned deadly. Here's what to do if you get bitten

items.synopsis: Max Knight's mother begged him not to leave her as he lay dying in her arms after a fire on their Queensland property. His dad was badly injured in the blaze and remains in hospital.

title.children: Community rallies after 5yo dies in mum's arms following Father's Day fire
